content: in green leaving an 8 inch/20 5 cm tail for sewing distribute sts across needles as you prefer and join row 1 working as if for i-cord pulling the yarn across the for working in the round back kfb 3 times 6 sts rounds 1-4 k distribute sts across needles as you prefer and join for round 5 ssk k4 k2tog 6 sts working in the round round 6 k round 7 ssk k2 k2tog 4 sts round 2 k round 3 kfb around 12 sts break yarn and pull through stitches to fasten_off round 4 k tail round 5 kfb k1 around 18 sts round 6 k co 6 stitches in green leaving long tail for sewing work as round 7 kfb k1 around 27 sts per i-cord pulling yarn across the back round 8 k round 9 kfb k2 around 36 sts rounds 1-2 k round 10 k round 3 k2tog k1 twice 4 sts round 11 kfb k3 around 45 sts round 4 k2tog twice 2 sts round 12 k round 13 kfb k4 around 54 sts break yarn and pull through stitches to fasten_off round 14 k finishing bobble leaving 24 inch/60 cm tail for sewing place the right stockinette sides of the shell top and bottom together using the thread from the bobble edge of the head shell bottom whip stitch the shell top and bottom together co 12 stitches in green leaving a 10 inch/28cm tail for around the outer edge leave a small 1 inch/2 5 cm opening sewing distribute sts across needles as you prefer and join for turning turn the shell right stockinette side out and stuff for working in the round loosely with polyester fiberfill sew closed and set aside round 1-2 k attach 2 safety eyes to the turtle s head and stuff whip round 3 k1 kfb k2 kfb k1 twice 16 sts stitch the co edge closed and weave in ends if desired round 4 k make nostrils on the front of the head using french knots round 5 k2 kfb k2 kfb k2 twice 20 sts rounds 6-9 k whip stitch the co edge closed on all flippers and the tail round 10 k2 k2tog k2 k2tog k2 twice 16 sts weave in all ends on the limbs round 11 k round 12 k1 k2tog k2 k2tog k1 twice 12 sts position the head limbs and tail around the underside of round 13 k2tog around 6 sts the shell along the seam they should be evenly spaced around the circular shell bottom pin them into place break yarn and pull through stitches to fasten_off using a piece of yarn in the same cc as the shell sew front flipper make 2 around the shell between the seam and the purl edge on co 10 stitches in green leaving an 8 inch/20 5 cm tail for the shell top to create a ridge as you sew around the body sewing distribute sts across needles as you prefer
